history.text: hi.  do you like movies?
Love movies.  How about you?
I do.  Sports movies are really of interest.
The Blind Side is one of my favorites.  Have you seen it?
Such a good movie.  I am a sucker for movies based on true stories and that is a particularly good one.  Is that the movie we are discussing?
yes, The Blind Side.  I am a huge Sandra Bullock fan.
What did you like about the movie?
I like that she is this tiny petitie southern lady and takes in this huge kid and teaches him respect as well as football.
what about you?
We have an adopted daughter so all the connections with adoption tug at my heart.  I also love the little brother in the movie.  What did you think about the racial issues in the movie?
kinda crazy huh?  i am from the northeast and we don't see that type of behavior.
even though Boston is a pretty white collar not very diverse Irish Catholic city, that behavior would never stand.
I'm from the NW.  I think where it is exists up here it is somewhat hidden beneath the surface but racism rears it's head still.  What did you think about the NCAA investigator in the movie?
i'd definitely watch it again.  you?
It is one of the few movies I own.  I've probably seen it 5-7 times.  How about you?
i don't recall the ncaa guy
i've seen it once striaght through and a couple times on tv but not the whole thing.

It was a woman.  The questions were surrounding if the family adopted him in order to get him to play for the school they went too.  It was really sad how it caused their adopted son to question their motives.
ah right
It is a good reminder that people use people all the time.  The vulnerable, like a poor kid from the projects can be targets.  Pretty sad reality.
Anything you didn't like about the movie?
i always thought as the real Leigh Ann really that tough on him?
for a kid who has run away and been through fosyer care you'd think he would have stuck around for someone more compassionate...
Yeah that is interesting.  The football coach at the school kind of bugged me.  He initially just saw the boy as a way to win games.
though i found it interesting they tested him and found he has high "protective instinct" score...
that was interesting.  Do you think that was real or just a cool story line in the movie?
regardless the writers of this movie did a great job
i garee
agree
anything else you noticed in the movie?
well, when he doubts Leigh Anns motives he runs back to his mother.
man that was a crazy scene back at his moms house.  I forgot about that.  Can you believe that is reality for tons of people in the USA
some gang leader threatens Leigh Ann or makes rude commetns and Michael loses his mind...  looked like a turning point
seems like michael finds help from the right people at the right times...  hollywood huh?
yeah.  I want to believe it was all true but obviously some is to make it a good movie.
How incredible that he made it to the NFL though.
still was a good story.
hard t compmress 4 or 5 years into 2 hours
that is very true.  Is Michael still in the NFL?
think so  Carolina Panthers now
wait... $20M contract with the Tennesee Titans.
homecoming for him of sorts
that is really cool.  long career for him.  What a story
well google says he is now retired.  failed his physical in 2017 for Carolina.
maybe acting is in his next career...  lol
Oh still a good long career.  Are we complete now?
think so
Cool didn't want to bail and mess it up for you!  Good chat
you too

uid2response.feedback: It happens to be a movie I love.  The conversation was smooth and informative.  Not much of a lag in conversation.
